intro: Psychotria cataractarum, commonly known as the "water psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in areas with high humidity and abundant rainfall. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Psychotria cataractarum is also known for its role in traditional medicine and its ecological importance in supporting local biodiversity.
